summary: Provides a sliding‑window inference engine for the HoVerNet pathology model, automatically partitioning large image volumes into configurable regions of interest, batching patches for model forward passes, and recombining overlapping predictions using constant or Gaussian weighting while handling padding, device placement, and optional CPU‑based stitching to lower GPU memory usage.
business_intent: Enables scalable, memory‑efficient deployment of HoVerNet‑based nuclei segmentation and classification on whole‑slide pathology images, supporting research and clinical workflows that require fast, accurate inference over very large image data.
